document_title: Decompensated cirrhosis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Decompensated cirrhosis is a complex disorder that affects many systems in the body, requiring a specialized approach for optimal management from the moment the patient is hospitalized. This condition has many different treatment options, but in the late stages, liver transplantation is always the preferred option.
Accordingly, the transplant process is performed with part or all of the organ from the donor. Liver tissue can regenerate, so patients can receive a liver from a living donor. Then, both the transplanted liver and the donor liver regenerate within a few months.
Treatment:
Every day, patients need to weigh themselves to know if they have fluid retention in cirrhosis; Treat the cause if any: specific drug treatment for hepatitis B and C viruses, stop drinking alcohol...; Symptomatic treatment: Take diuretics when there is edema or ascites; Prevention of gastrointestinal bleeding due to ruptured varicose veins
